Author: tigerchik
Text: I would argue that the medical professionals' job is to help you get to a healthy weight in a healthy way. Just like they insist on people gaining to get to a healthy weight, you should be given help to get to a healthy weight. That's a long term plan... initially it's probably more important to stabilize behaviours... but I'd advocate for yourself for their helping you get to a healthy BMI. Does that make sense?

Author: jakisaur
Text: when I was IP on a meal plan, I did lose weight bc I was a bit overweight, so it's definitely possible! take advantage of having someone to keep you accountable. it makes eating normally so much easier.   some tips to keep it up after things turn around for you:  1. resist purging at all costs bc it'll just make you hungrier and screw everything up.   2. don't count calories no matter how much you want to lose weight. it always becomes obsessive for people with our brains.   3. slow, healthy weight loss is still weight loss. you don't have to starve yourself to lose weight. it's just faster. but you have time! and you'll have so much more if you can stop hurting your body.
